50static inline bool
51_hb_codepoint_is_regional_indicator (hb_codepoint_t u)
52{ return hb_in_range<hb_codepoint_t> (u, lo: 0x1F1E6u, hi: 0x1F1FFu); }
53
54#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
55static inline bool
56_hb_apply_morx (hb_face_t *face, const hb_segment_properties_t &props)
57{
58 /* https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/2124 */
59 return hb_aat_layout_has_substitution (face) &&
60 (HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (props.direction) || !hb_ot_layout_has_substitution (face));
61}
62#endif
63
64/**
65 * SECTION:hb-ot-shape
66 * @title: hb-ot-shape
67 * @short_description: OpenType shaping support
68 * @include: hb-ot.h
69 *
70 * Support functions for OpenType shaping related queries.
71 **/
72
73
74static void
75hb_ot_shape_collect_features (hb_ot_shape_planner_t *planner,
76 const hb_feature_t *user_features,
77 unsigned int num_user_features);
78
79hb_ot_shape_planner_t::hb_ot_shape_planner_t (hb_face_t *face,
80 const hb_segment_properties_t &props) :
81 face (face),
82 props (props),
83 map (face, props)
84#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
85 , apply_morx (_hb_apply_morx (face, props))
86#endif
87{
88 shaper = hb_ot_shaper_categorize (planner: this);
89
90 script_zero_marks = shaper->zero_width_marks != HB_OT_SHAPE_ZERO_WIDTH_MARKS_NONE;
91 script_fallback_mark_positioning = shaper->fallback_position;
92
93#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
94 /* https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/1528 */
95 if (apply_morx && shaper != &_hb_ot_shaper_default)
96 shaper = &_hb_ot_shaper_dumber;
97#endif
98}
99
100void
101hb_ot_shape_planner_t::compile (hb_ot_shape_plan_t &plan,
102 const hb_ot_shape_plan_key_t &key)
103{
104 plan.props = props;
105 plan.shaper = shaper;
106 map.compile (m&: plan.map, key);
107
108#ifndef HB_NO_OT_SHAPE_FRACTIONS
109 plan.frac_mask = plan.map.get_1_mask (HB_TAG ('f','r','a','c'));
110 plan.numr_mask = plan.map.get_1_mask (HB_TAG ('n','u','m','r'));
111 plan.dnom_mask = plan.map.get_1_mask (HB_TAG ('d','n','o','m'));
112 plan.has_frac = plan.frac_mask || (plan.numr_mask && plan.dnom_mask);
113#endif
114
115 plan.rtlm_mask = plan.map.get_1_mask (HB_TAG ('r','t','l','m'));
116 plan.has_vert = !!plan.map.get_1_mask (HB_TAG ('v','e','r','t'));
117
118 hb_tag_t kern_tag = HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (props.direction) ?
119 HB_TAG ('k','e','r','n') : HB_TAG ('v','k','r','n');
120#ifndef HB_NO_OT_KERN
121 plan.kern_mask = plan.map.get_mask (feature_tag: kern_tag);
122 plan.requested_kerning = !!plan.kern_mask;
123#endif
124#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
125 plan.trak_mask = plan.map.get_mask (HB_TAG ('t','r','a','k'));
126 plan.requested_tracking = !!plan.trak_mask;
127#endif
128
129 bool has_gpos_kern = plan.map.get_feature_index (table_index: 1, feature_tag: kern_tag) != HB_OT_LAYOUT_NO_FEATURE_INDEX;
130 bool disable_gpos = plan.shaper->gpos_tag &&
131 plan.shaper->gpos_tag != plan.map.chosen_script[1];
132
133 /*
134 * Decide who provides glyph classes. GDEF or Unicode.
135 */
136
137 if (!hb_ot_layout_has_glyph_classes (face))
138 plan.fallback_glyph_classes = true;
139
140 /*
141 * Decide who does substitutions. GSUB, morx, or fallback.
142 */
143
144#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
145 plan.apply_morx = apply_morx;
146#endif
147
148 /*
149 * Decide who does positioning. GPOS, kerx, kern, or fallback.
150 */
151
152#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
153 bool has_kerx = hb_aat_layout_has_positioning (face);
154 bool has_gsub = !apply_morx && hb_ot_layout_has_substitution (face);
155#endif
156 bool has_gpos = !disable_gpos && hb_ot_layout_has_positioning (face);
157 if (false)
158 ;
159#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
160 /* Prefer GPOS over kerx if GSUB is present;
161 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/3008 */
162 else if (has_kerx && !(has_gsub && has_gpos))
163 plan.apply_kerx = true;
164#endif
165 else if (has_gpos)
166 plan.apply_gpos = true;
167
168 if (!plan.apply_kerx && (!has_gpos_kern || !plan.apply_gpos))
169 {
170#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
171 if (has_kerx)
172 plan.apply_kerx = true;
173 else
174#endif
175#ifndef HB_NO_OT_KERN
176 if (hb_ot_layout_has_kerning (face))
177 plan.apply_kern = true;
178#endif
179 }
180
181 plan.apply_fallback_kern = !(plan.apply_gpos || plan.apply_kerx || plan.apply_kern);
182
183 plan.zero_marks = script_zero_marks &&
184 !plan.apply_kerx &&
185 (!plan.apply_kern
186#ifndef HB_NO_OT_KERN
187 || !hb_ot_layout_has_machine_kerning (face)
188#endif
189 );
190 plan.has_gpos_mark = !!plan.map.get_1_mask (HB_TAG ('m','a','r','k'));
191
192 plan.adjust_mark_positioning_when_zeroing = !plan.apply_gpos &&
193 !plan.apply_kerx &&
194 (!plan.apply_kern
195#ifndef HB_NO_OT_KERN
196 || !hb_ot_layout_has_cross_kerning (face)
197#endif
198 );
199
200 plan.fallback_mark_positioning = plan.adjust_mark_positioning_when_zeroing &&
201 script_fallback_mark_positioning;
202
203#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
204 /* If we're using morx shaping, we cancel mark position adjustment because
205 Apple Color Emoji assumes this will NOT be done when forming emoji sequences;
206 https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/2967. */
207 if (plan.apply_morx)
208 plan.adjust_mark_positioning_when_zeroing = false;
209
210 /* Currently we always apply trak. */
211 plan.apply_trak = plan.requested_tracking && hb_aat_layout_has_tracking (face);
212#endif
213}
214
215bool
216hb_ot_shape_plan_t::init0 (hb_face_t *face,
217 const hb_shape_plan_key_t *key)
218{
219 map.init ();
220
221 hb_ot_shape_planner_t planner (face,
222 key->props);
223
224 hb_ot_shape_collect_features (planner: &planner,
225 user_features: key->user_features,
226 num_user_features: key->num_user_features);
227
228 planner.compile (plan&: *this, key: key->ot);
229
230 if (shaper->data_create)
231 {
232 data = shaper->data_create (this);
233 if (unlikely (!data))
234 {
235 map.fini ();
236 return false;
237 }
238 }
239
240 return true;
241}
242
243void
244hb_ot_shape_plan_t::fini ()
245{
246 if (shaper->data_destroy)
247 shaper->data_destroy (const_cast<void *> (data));
248
249 map.fini ();
250}
251
252void
253hb_ot_shape_plan_t::substitute (hb_font_t *font,
254 hb_buffer_t *buffer) const
255{
256 map.substitute (plan: this, font, buffer);
257}
258
259void
260hb_ot_shape_plan_t::position (hb_font_t *font,
261 hb_buffer_t *buffer) const
262{
263 if (this->apply_gpos)
264 map.position (plan: this, font, buffer);
265#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
266 else if (this->apply_kerx)
267 hb_aat_layout_position (plan: this, font, buffer);
268#endif
269
270#ifndef HB_NO_OT_KERN
271 if (this->apply_kern)
272 hb_ot_layout_kern (plan: this, font, buffer);
273#endif
274 else if (this->apply_fallback_kern)
275 _hb_ot_shape_fallback_kern (plan: this, font, buffer);
276
277#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
278 if (this->apply_trak)
279 hb_aat_layout_track (plan: this, font, buffer);
280#endif
281}
282
283
284static const hb_ot_map_feature_t
285common_features[] =
286{
287 {HB_TAG('a','b','v','m'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
288 {HB_TAG('b','l','w','m'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
289 {HB_TAG('c','c','m','p'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
290 {HB_TAG('l','o','c','l'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
291 {HB_TAG('m','a','r','k'), .flags: F_GLOBAL_MANUAL_JOINERS},
292 {HB_TAG('m','k','m','k'), .flags: F_GLOBAL_MANUAL_JOINERS},
293 {HB_TAG('r','l','i','g'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
294};
295
296
297static const hb_ot_map_feature_t
298horizontal_features[] =
299{
300 {HB_TAG('c','a','l','t'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
301 {HB_TAG('c','l','i','g'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
302 {HB_TAG('c','u','r','s'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
303 {HB_TAG('d','i','s','t'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
304 {HB_TAG('k','e','r','n'), .flags: F_GLOBAL_HAS_FALLBACK},
305 {HB_TAG('l','i','g','a'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
306 {HB_TAG('r','c','l','t'), .flags: F_GLOBAL},
307};
308
309static void
310hb_ot_shape_collect_features (hb_ot_shape_planner_t *planner,
311 const hb_feature_t *user_features,
312 unsigned int num_user_features)
313{
314 hb_ot_map_builder_t *map = &planner->map;
315
316 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG('r','v','r','n'));
317 map->add_gsub_pause (pause_func: nullptr);
318
319 switch (planner->props.direction)
320 {
321 case HB_DIRECTION_LTR:
322 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('l','t','r','a'));
323 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('l','t','r','m'));
324 break;
325 case HB_DIRECTION_RTL:
326 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('r','t','l','a'));
327 map->add_feature (HB_TAG ('r','t','l','m'));
328 break;
329 case HB_DIRECTION_TTB:
330 case HB_DIRECTION_BTT:
331 case HB_DIRECTION_INVALID:
332 default:
333 break;
334 }
335
336#ifndef HB_NO_OT_SHAPE_FRACTIONS
337 /* Automatic fractions. */
338 map->add_feature (HB_TAG ('f','r','a','c'));
339 map->add_feature (HB_TAG ('n','u','m','r'));
340 map->add_feature (HB_TAG ('d','n','o','m'));
341#endif
342
343 /* Random! */
344 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('r','a','n','d'), flags: F_RANDOM, HB_OT_MAP_MAX_VALUE);
345
346#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
347 /* Tracking. We enable dummy feature here just to allow disabling
348 * AAT 'trak' table using features.
349 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/1303 */
350 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('t','r','a','k'), flags: F_HAS_FALLBACK);
351#endif
352
353 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('H','a','r','f')); /* Considered required. */
354 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('H','A','R','F')); /* Considered discretionary. */
355
356 if (planner->shaper->collect_features)
357 planner->shaper->collect_features (planner);
358
359 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('B','u','z','z')); /* Considered required. */
360 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('B','U','Z','Z')); /* Considered discretionary. */
361
362 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ARRAY_LENGTH (common_features); i++)
363 map->add_feature (feat: common_features[i]);
364
365 if (HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (planner->props.direction))
366 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < ARRAY_LENGTH (horizontal_features); i++)
367 map->add_feature (feat: horizontal_features[i]);
368 else
369 {
370 /* We only apply `vert` feature. See:
371 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/commit/d71c0df2d17f4590d5611239577a6cb532c26528
372 * https://lists.freedesktop.org/archives/harfbuzz/2013-August/003490.html */
373
374 /* We really want to find a 'vert' feature if there's any in the font, no
375 * matter which script/langsys it is listed (or not) under.
376 * See various bugs referenced from:
377 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/63 */
378 map->enable_feature (HB_TAG ('v','e','r','t'), flags: F_GLOBAL_SEARCH);
379 }
380
381 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_user_features; i++)
382 {
383 const hb_feature_t *feature = &user_features[i];
384 map->add_feature (tag: feature->tag,
385 flags: (feature->start == HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_START &&
386 feature->end == HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_END) ? F_GLOBAL : F_NONE,
387 value: feature->value);
388 }
389
390 if (planner->shaper->override_features)
391 planner->shaper->override_features (planner);
392}

431/*
432 * shaper
433 */
434
435struct hb_ot_shape_context_t
436{
437 hb_ot_shape_plan_t *plan;
438 hb_font_t *font;
439 hb_face_t *face;
440 hb_buffer_t *buffer;
441 const hb_feature_t *user_features;
442 unsigned int num_user_features;
443
444 /* Transient stuff */
445 hb_direction_t target_direction;
446};
447
448
449
450/* Main shaper */
451
452
453/* Prepare */
454
455static void
456hb_set_unicode_props (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
457{
458 /* Implement enough of Unicode Graphemes here that shaping
459 * in reverse-direction wouldn't break graphemes. Namely,
460 * we mark all marks and ZWJ and ZWJ,Extended_Pictographic
461 * sequences as continuations. The foreach_grapheme()
462 * macro uses this bit.
463 *
464 * https://www.unicode.org/reports/tr29/#Regex_Definitions
465 */
466 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
467 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
468 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
469 {
470 _hb_glyph_info_set_unicode_props (info: &info[i], buffer);
471
472 /* Marks are already set as continuation by the above line.
473 * Handle Emoji_Modifier and ZWJ-continuation. */
474 if (unlikely (_hb_glyph_info_get_general_category (&info[i]) == HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_MODIFIER_SYMBOL &&
475 hb_in_range<hb_codepoint_t> (info[i].codepoint, 0x1F3FBu, 0x1F3FFu)))
476 {
477 _hb_glyph_info_set_continuation (info: &info[i]);
478 }
479 /* Regional_Indicators are hairy as hell...
480 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/2265 */
481 else if (unlikely (i && _hb_codepoint_is_regional_indicator (info[i].codepoint)))
482 {
483 if (_hb_codepoint_is_regional_indicator (u: info[i - 1].codepoint) &&
484 !_hb_glyph_info_is_continuation (info: &info[i - 1]))
485 _hb_glyph_info_set_continuation (info: &info[i]);
486 }
487#ifndef HB_NO_EMOJI_SEQUENCES
488 else if (unlikely (_hb_glyph_info_is_zwj (&info[i])))
489 {
490 _hb_glyph_info_set_continuation (info: &info[i]);
491 if (i + 1 < count &&
492 _hb_unicode_is_emoji_Extended_Pictographic (cp: info[i + 1].codepoint))
493 {
494 i++;
495 _hb_glyph_info_set_unicode_props (info: &info[i], buffer);
496 _hb_glyph_info_set_continuation (info: &info[i]);
497 }
498 }
499#endif
500 /* Or part of the Other_Grapheme_Extend that is not marks.
501 * As of Unicode 15 that is just:
502 *
503 * 200C ; Other_Grapheme_Extend # Cf ZERO WIDTH NON-JOINER
504 * FF9E..FF9F ; Other_Grapheme_Extend # Lm [2] HALFWIDTH KATAKANA VOICED SOUND MARK..HALFWIDTH KATAKANA SEMI-VOICED SOUND MARK
505 * E0020..E007F ; Other_Grapheme_Extend # Cf [96] TAG SPACE..CANCEL TAG
506 *
507 * ZWNJ is special, we don't want to merge it as there's no need, and keeping
508 * it separate results in more granular clusters.
509 * Tags are used for Emoji sub-region flag sequences:
510 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/1556
511 * Katakana ones were requested:
512 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/3844
513 */
514 else if (unlikely (hb_in_ranges<hb_codepoint_t> (info[i].codepoint, 0xFF9Eu, 0xFF9Fu, 0xE0020u, 0xE007Fu)))
515 _hb_glyph_info_set_continuation (info: &info[i]);
516 }
517}
518
519static void
520hb_insert_dotted_circle (hb_buffer_t *buffer, hb_font_t *font)
521{
522 if (unlikely (buffer->flags & HB_BUFFER_FLAG_DO_NOT_INSERT_DOTTED_CIRCLE))
523 return;
524
525 if (!(buffer->flags & HB_BUFFER_FLAG_BOT) ||
526 buffer->context_len[0] ||
527 !_hb_glyph_info_is_unicode_mark (info: &buffer->info[0]))
528 return;
529
530 if (!font->has_glyph (unicode: 0x25CCu))
531 return;
532
533 hb_glyph_info_t dottedcircle = {.codepoint: 0};
534 dottedcircle.codepoint = 0x25CCu;
535 _hb_glyph_info_set_unicode_props (info: &dottedcircle, buffer);
536
537 buffer->clear_output ();
538
539 buffer->idx = 0;
540 hb_glyph_info_t info = dottedcircle;
541 info.cluster = buffer->cur().cluster;
542 info.mask = buffer->cur().mask;
543 (void) buffer->output_info (glyph_info: info);
544
545 buffer->sync ();
546}
547
548static void
549hb_form_clusters (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
550{
551 if (!(buffer->scratch_flags & HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_HAS_NON_ASCII))
552 return;
553
554 if (buffer->cluster_level == HB_BUFFER_CLUSTER_LEVEL_MONOTONE_GRAPHEMES)
555 foreach_grapheme (buffer, start, end)
556 buffer->merge_clusters (start, end);
557 else
558 foreach_grapheme (buffer, start, end)
559 buffer->unsafe_to_break (start, end);
560}
561
562static void
563hb_ensure_native_direction (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
564{
565 hb_direction_t direction = buffer->props.direction;
566 hb_direction_t horiz_dir = hb_script_get_horizontal_direction (script: buffer->props.script);
567
568 /* Numeric runs in natively-RTL scripts are actually native-LTR, so we reset
569 * the horiz_dir if the run contains at least one decimal-number char, and no
570 * letter chars (ideally we should be checking for chars with strong
571 * directionality but hb-unicode currently lacks bidi categories).
572 *
573 * This allows digit sequences in Arabic etc to be shaped in "native"
574 * direction, so that features like ligatures will work as intended.
575 *
576 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/501
577 *
578 * Similar thing about Regional_Indicators; They are bidi=L, but Script=Common.
579 * If they are present in a run of natively-RTL text, they get assigned a script
580 * with natively RTL direction, which would result in wrong shaping if we
581 * assign such native RTL direction to them then. Detect that as well.
582 *
583 * https://github.com/harfbuzz/harfbuzz/issues/3314
584 */
585 if (unlikely (horiz_dir == HB_DIRECTION_RTL && direction == HB_DIRECTION_LTR))
586 {
587 bool found_number = false, found_letter = false, found_ri = false;
588 const auto* info = buffer->info;
589 const auto count = buffer->len;
590 for (unsigned i = 0; i < count; i++)
591 {
592 auto gc = _hb_glyph_info_get_general_category (info: &info[i]);
593 if (gc == HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_DECIMAL_NUMBER)
594 found_number = true;
595 else if (HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_IS_LETTER (gc))
596 {
597 found_letter = true;
598 break;
599 }
600 else if (_hb_codepoint_is_regional_indicator (u: info[i].codepoint))
601 found_ri = true;
602 }
603 if ((found_number || found_ri) && !found_letter)
604 horiz_dir = HB_DIRECTION_LTR;
605 }
606
607 /* TODO vertical:
608 * The only BTT vertical script is Ogham, but it's not clear to me whether OpenType
609 * Ogham fonts are supposed to be implemented BTT or not. Need to research that
610 * first. */
611 if ((HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (direction) &&
612 direction != horiz_dir && horiz_dir != HB_DIRECTION_INVALID) ||
613 (HB_DIRECTION_IS_VERTICAL (direction) &&
614 direction != HB_DIRECTION_TTB))
615 {
616 _hb_ot_layout_reverse_graphemes (buffer);
617 buffer->props.direction = HB_DIRECTION_REVERSE (buffer->props.direction);
618 }
619}
620
621
622/*
623 * Substitute
624 */
625
626#ifndef HB_NO_VERTICAL
627static hb_codepoint_t
628hb_vert_char_for (hb_codepoint_t u)
629{
630 switch (u >> 8)
631 {
632 case 0x20: switch (u) {
633 case 0x2013u: return 0xfe32u; // EN DASH
634 case 0x2014u: return 0xfe31u; // EM DASH
635 case 0x2025u: return 0xfe30u; // TWO DOT LEADER
636 case 0x2026u: return 0xfe19u; // HORIZONTAL ELLIPSIS
637 } break;
638 case 0x30: switch (u) {
639 case 0x3001u: return 0xfe11u; // IDEOGRAPHIC COMMA
640 case 0x3002u: return 0xfe12u; // IDEOGRAPHIC FULL STOP
641 case 0x3008u: return 0xfe3fu; // LEFT ANGLE BRACKET
642 case 0x3009u: return 0xfe40u; // RIGHT ANGLE BRACKET
643 case 0x300au: return 0xfe3du; // LEFT DOUBLE ANGLE BRACKET
644 case 0x300bu: return 0xfe3eu; // RIGHT DOUBLE ANGLE BRACKET
645 case 0x300cu: return 0xfe41u; // LEFT CORNER BRACKET
646 case 0x300du: return 0xfe42u; // RIGHT CORNER BRACKET
647 case 0x300eu: return 0xfe43u; // LEFT WHITE CORNER BRACKET
648 case 0x300fu: return 0xfe44u; // RIGHT WHITE CORNER BRACKET
649 case 0x3010u: return 0xfe3bu; // LEFT BLACK LENTICULAR BRACKET
650 case 0x3011u: return 0xfe3cu; // RIGHT BLACK LENTICULAR BRACKET
651 case 0x3014u: return 0xfe39u; // LEFT TORTOISE SHELL BRACKET
652 case 0x3015u: return 0xfe3au; // RIGHT TORTOISE SHELL BRACKET
653 case 0x3016u: return 0xfe17u; // LEFT WHITE LENTICULAR BRACKET
654 case 0x3017u: return 0xfe18u; // RIGHT WHITE LENTICULAR BRACKET
655 } break;
656 case 0xfe: switch (u) {
657 case 0xfe4fu: return 0xfe34u; // WAVY LOW LINE
658 } break;
659 case 0xff: switch (u) {
660 case 0xff01u: return 0xfe15u; // FULLWIDTH EXCLAMATION MARK
661 case 0xff08u: return 0xfe35u; // FULLWIDTH LEFT PARENTHESIS
662 case 0xff09u: return 0xfe36u; // FULLWIDTH RIGHT PARENTHESIS
663 case 0xff0cu: return 0xfe10u; // FULLWIDTH COMMA
664 case 0xff1au: return 0xfe13u; // FULLWIDTH COLON
665 case 0xff1bu: return 0xfe14u; // FULLWIDTH SEMICOLON
666 case 0xff1fu: return 0xfe16u; // FULLWIDTH QUESTION MARK
667 case 0xff3bu: return 0xfe47u; // FULLWIDTH LEFT SQUARE BRACKET
668 case 0xff3du: return 0xfe48u; // FULLWIDTH RIGHT SQUARE BRACKET
669 case 0xff3fu: return 0xfe33u; // FULLWIDTH LOW LINE
670 case 0xff5bu: return 0xfe37u; // FULLWIDTH LEFT CURLY BRACKET
671 case 0xff5du: return 0xfe38u; // FULLWIDTH RIGHT CURLY BRACKET
672 } break;
673 }
674
675 return u;
676}
677#endif
678
679static inline void
680hb_ot_rotate_chars (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
681{
682 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
683 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
684 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
685
686 if (HB_DIRECTION_IS_BACKWARD (c->target_direction))
687 {
688 hb_unicode_funcs_t *unicode = buffer->unicode;
689 hb_mask_t rtlm_mask = c->plan->rtlm_mask;
690
691 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
692 hb_codepoint_t codepoint = unicode->mirroring (unicode: info[i].codepoint);
693 if (unlikely (codepoint != info[i].codepoint && c->font->has_glyph (codepoint)))
694 info[i].codepoint = codepoint;
695 else
696 info[i].mask |= rtlm_mask;
697 }
698 }
699
700#ifndef HB_NO_VERTICAL
701 if (HB_DIRECTION_IS_VERTICAL (c->target_direction) && !c->plan->has_vert)
702 {
703 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
704 hb_codepoint_t codepoint = hb_vert_char_for (u: info[i].codepoint);
705 if (unlikely (codepoint != info[i].codepoint && c->font->has_glyph (codepoint)))
706 info[i].codepoint = codepoint;
707 }
708 }
709#endif
710}
711
712static inline void
713hb_ot_shape_setup_masks_fraction (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
714{
715#ifdef HB_NO_OT_SHAPE_FRACTIONS
716 return;
717#endif
718
719 if (!(c->buffer->scratch_flags & HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_HAS_NON_ASCII) ||
720 !c->plan->has_frac)
721 return;
722
723 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
724
725 hb_mask_t pre_mask, post_mask;
726 if (HB_DIRECTION_IS_FORWARD (buffer->props.direction))
727 {
728 pre_mask = c->plan->numr_mask | c->plan->frac_mask;
729 post_mask = c->plan->frac_mask | c->plan->dnom_mask;
730 }
731 else
732 {
733 pre_mask = c->plan->frac_mask | c->plan->dnom_mask;
734 post_mask = c->plan->numr_mask | c->plan->frac_mask;
735 }
736
737 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
738 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
739 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
740 {
741 if (info[i].codepoint == 0x2044u) /* FRACTION SLASH */
742 {
743 unsigned int start = i, end = i + 1;
744 while (start &&
745 _hb_glyph_info_get_general_category (info: &info[start - 1]) ==
746 HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_DECIMAL_NUMBER)
747 start--;
748 while (end < count &&
749 _hb_glyph_info_get_general_category (info: &info[end]) ==
750 HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_DECIMAL_NUMBER)
751 end++;
752
753 buffer->unsafe_to_break (start, end);
754
755 for (unsigned int j = start; j < i; j++)
756 info[j].mask |= pre_mask;
757 info[i].mask |= c->plan->frac_mask;
758 for (unsigned int j = i + 1; j < end; j++)
759 info[j].mask |= post_mask;
760
761 i = end - 1;
762 }
763 }
764}
765
766static inline void
767hb_ot_shape_initialize_masks (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
768{
769 hb_ot_map_t *map = &c->plan->map;
770 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
771
772 hb_mask_t global_mask = map->get_global_mask ();
773 buffer->reset_masks (mask: global_mask);
774}
775
776static inline void
777hb_ot_shape_setup_masks (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
778{
779 hb_ot_map_t *map = &c->plan->map;
780 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
781
782 hb_ot_shape_setup_masks_fraction (c);
783
784 if (c->plan->shaper->setup_masks)
785 c->plan->shaper->setup_masks (c->plan, buffer, c->font);
786
787 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < c->num_user_features; i++)
788 {
789 const hb_feature_t *feature = &c->user_features[i];
790 if (!(feature->start == HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_START && feature->end == HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_END)) {
791 unsigned int shift;
792 hb_mask_t mask = map->get_mask (feature_tag: feature->tag, shift: &shift);
793 buffer->set_masks (value: feature->value << shift, mask, cluster_start: feature->start, cluster_end: feature->end);
794 }
795 }
796}
797
798static void
799hb_ot_zero_width_default_ignorables (const hb_buffer_t *buffer)
800{
801 if (!(buffer->scratch_flags & HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_HAS_DEFAULT_IGNORABLES) ||
802 (buffer->flags & HB_BUFFER_FLAG_PRESERVE_DEFAULT_IGNORABLES) ||
803 (buffer->flags & HB_BUFFER_FLAG_REMOVE_DEFAULT_IGNORABLES))
804 return;
805
806 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
807 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
808 hb_glyph_position_t *pos = buffer->pos;
809 unsigned int i = 0;
810 for (i = 0; i < count; i++)
811 if (unlikely (_hb_glyph_info_is_default_ignorable (&info[i])))
812 pos[i].x_advance = pos[i].y_advance = pos[i].x_offset = pos[i].y_offset = 0;
813}
814
815static void
816hb_ot_hide_default_ignorables (hb_buffer_t *buffer,
817 hb_font_t *font)
818{
819 if (!(buffer->scratch_flags & HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_HAS_DEFAULT_IGNORABLES) ||
820 (buffer->flags & HB_BUFFER_FLAG_PRESERVE_DEFAULT_IGNORABLES))
821 return;
822
823 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
824 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
825
826 hb_codepoint_t invisible = buffer->invisible;
827 if (!(buffer->flags & HB_BUFFER_FLAG_REMOVE_DEFAULT_IGNORABLES) &&
828 (invisible || font->get_nominal_glyph (unicode: ' ', glyph: &invisible)))
829 {
830 /* Replace default-ignorables with a zero-advance invisible glyph. */
831 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
832 {
833 if (_hb_glyph_info_is_default_ignorable (info: &info[i]))
834 info[i].codepoint = invisible;
835 }
836 }
837 else
838 buffer->delete_glyphs_inplace (filter: _hb_glyph_info_is_default_ignorable);
839}
840
841
842static inline void
843hb_ot_map_glyphs_fast (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
844{
845 /* Normalization process sets up glyph_index(), we just copy it. */
846 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
847 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
848 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
849 info[i].codepoint = info[i].glyph_index();
850
851 buffer->content_type = HB_BUFFER_CONTENT_TYPE_GLYPHS;
852}
853
854static inline void
855hb_synthesize_glyph_classes (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
856{
857 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
858 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
859 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
860 {
861 hb_ot_layout_glyph_props_flags_t klass;
862
863 /* Never mark default-ignorables as marks.
864 * They won't get in the way of lookups anyway,
865 * but having them as mark will cause them to be skipped
866 * over if the lookup-flag says so, but at least for the
867 * Mongolian variation selectors, looks like Uniscribe
868 * marks them as non-mark. Some Mongolian fonts without
869 * GDEF rely on this. Another notable character that
870 * this applies to is COMBINING GRAPHEME JOINER. */
871 klass = (_hb_glyph_info_get_general_category (info: &info[i]) !=
872 HB_UNICODE_GENERAL_CATEGORY_NON_SPACING_MARK ||
873 _hb_glyph_info_is_default_ignorable (info: &info[i])) ?
874 HB_OT_LAYOUT_GLYPH_PROPS_BASE_GLYPH :
875 HB_OT_LAYOUT_GLYPH_PROPS_MARK;
876 _hb_glyph_info_set_glyph_props (info: &info[i], props: klass);
877 }
878}
879
880static inline void
881hb_ot_substitute_default (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
882{
883 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
884
885 hb_ot_rotate_chars (c);
886
887 HB_BUFFER_ALLOCATE_VAR (buffer, glyph_index);
888
889 _hb_ot_shape_normalize (shaper: c->plan, buffer, font: c->font);
890
891 hb_ot_shape_setup_masks (c);
892
893 /* This is unfortunate to go here, but necessary... */
894 if (c->plan->fallback_mark_positioning)
895 _hb_ot_shape_fallback_mark_position_recategorize_marks (plan: c->plan, font: c->font, buffer);
896
897 hb_ot_map_glyphs_fast (buffer);
898
899 HB_BUFFER_DEALLOCATE_VAR (buffer, glyph_index);
900}
901
902static inline void
903hb_ot_substitute_plan (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
904{
905 hb_buffer_t *buffer = c->buffer;
906
907 hb_ot_layout_substitute_start (font: c->font, buffer);
908
909 if (c->plan->fallback_glyph_classes)
910 hb_synthesize_glyph_classes (buffer: c->buffer);
911
912#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
913 if (unlikely (c->plan->apply_morx))
914 hb_aat_layout_substitute (plan: c->plan, font: c->font, buffer: c->buffer,
915 features: c->user_features, num_features: c->num_user_features);
916 else
917#endif
918 c->plan->substitute (font: c->font, buffer);
919}
920
921static inline void
922hb_ot_substitute_pre (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
923{
924 hb_ot_substitute_default (c);
925
926 _hb_buffer_allocate_gsubgpos_vars (buffer: c->buffer);
927
928 hb_ot_substitute_plan (c);
929
930#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
931 if (c->plan->apply_morx && c->plan->apply_gpos)
932 hb_aat_layout_remove_deleted_glyphs (buffer: c->buffer);
933#endif
934}
935
936static inline void
937hb_ot_substitute_post (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
938{
939#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
940 if (c->plan->apply_morx && !c->plan->apply_gpos)
941 hb_aat_layout_remove_deleted_glyphs (buffer: c->buffer);
942#endif
943
944 hb_ot_hide_default_ignorables (buffer: c->buffer, font: c->font);
945
946 if (c->plan->shaper->postprocess_glyphs &&
947 c->buffer->message(font: c->font, fmt: "start postprocess-glyphs")) {
948 c->plan->shaper->postprocess_glyphs (c->plan, c->buffer, c->font);
949 (void) c->buffer->message(font: c->font, fmt: "end postprocess-glyphs");
950 }
951}
952
953
954/*
955 * Position
956 */
957
958static inline void
959adjust_mark_offsets (hb_glyph_position_t *pos)
960{
961 pos->x_offset -= pos->x_advance;
962 pos->y_offset -= pos->y_advance;
963}
964
965static inline void
966zero_mark_width (hb_glyph_position_t *pos)
967{
968 pos->x_advance = 0;
969 pos->y_advance = 0;
970}
971
972static inline void
973zero_mark_widths_by_gdef (hb_buffer_t *buffer, bool adjust_offsets)
974{
975 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
976 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
977 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
978 if (_hb_glyph_info_is_mark (info: &info[i]))
979 {
980 if (adjust_offsets)
981 adjust_mark_offsets (pos: &buffer->pos[i]);
982 zero_mark_width (pos: &buffer->pos[i]);
983 }
984}
985
986static inline void
987hb_ot_position_default (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
988{
989 hb_direction_t direction = c->buffer->props.direction;
990 unsigned int count = c->buffer->len;
991 hb_glyph_info_t *info = c->buffer->info;
992 hb_glyph_position_t *pos = c->buffer->pos;
993
994 if (HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL (direction))
995 {
996 c->font->get_glyph_h_advances (count, first_glyph: &info[0].codepoint, glyph_stride: sizeof(info[0]),
997 first_advance: &pos[0].x_advance, advance_stride: sizeof(pos[0]));
998 /* The nil glyph_h_origin() func returns 0, so no need to apply it. */
999 if (c->font->has_glyph_h_origin_func ())
1000 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
1001 c->font->subtract_glyph_h_origin (glyph: info[i].codepoint,
1002 x: &pos[i].x_offset,
1003 y: &pos[i].y_offset);
1004 }
1005 else
1006 {
1007 c->font->get_glyph_v_advances (count, first_glyph: &info[0].codepoint, glyph_stride: sizeof(info[0]),
1008 first_advance: &pos[0].y_advance, advance_stride: sizeof(pos[0]));
1009 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
1010 {
1011 c->font->subtract_glyph_v_origin (glyph: info[i].codepoint,
1012 x: &pos[i].x_offset,
1013 y: &pos[i].y_offset);
1014 }
1015 }
1016 if (c->buffer->scratch_flags & HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_HAS_SPACE_FALLBACK)
1017 _hb_ot_shape_fallback_spaces (plan: c->plan, font: c->font, buffer: c->buffer);
1018}
1019
1020static inline void
1021hb_ot_position_plan (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
1022{
1023 unsigned int count = c->buffer->len;
1024 hb_glyph_info_t *info = c->buffer->info;
1025 hb_glyph_position_t *pos = c->buffer->pos;
1026
1027 /* If the font has no GPOS and direction is forward, then when
1028 * zeroing mark widths, we shift the mark with it, such that the
1029 * mark is positioned hanging over the previous glyph. When
1030 * direction is backward we don't shift and it will end up
1031 * hanging over the next glyph after the final reordering.
1032 *
1033 * Note: If fallback positinoing happens, we don't care about
1034 * this as it will be overridden.
1035 */
1036 bool adjust_offsets_when_zeroing = c->plan->adjust_mark_positioning_when_zeroing &&
1037 HB_DIRECTION_IS_FORWARD (c->buffer->props.direction);
1038
1039 /* We change glyph origin to what GPOS expects (horizontal), apply GPOS, change it back. */
1040
1041 /* The nil glyph_h_origin() func returns 0, so no need to apply it. */
1042 if (c->font->has_glyph_h_origin_func ())
1043 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
1044 c->font->add_glyph_h_origin (glyph: info[i].codepoint,
1045 x: &pos[i].x_offset,
1046 y: &pos[i].y_offset);
1047
1048 hb_ot_layout_position_start (font: c->font, buffer: c->buffer);
1049
1050 if (c->plan->zero_marks)
1051 switch (c->plan->shaper->zero_width_marks)
1052 {
1053 case HB_OT_SHAPE_ZERO_WIDTH_MARKS_BY_GDEF_EARLY:
1054 zero_mark_widths_by_gdef (buffer: c->buffer, adjust_offsets: adjust_offsets_when_zeroing);
1055 break;
1056
1057 default:
1058 case HB_OT_SHAPE_ZERO_WIDTH_MARKS_NONE:
1059 case HB_OT_SHAPE_ZERO_WIDTH_MARKS_BY_GDEF_LATE:
1060 break;
1061 }
1062
1063 c->plan->position (font: c->font, buffer: c->buffer);
1064
1065 if (c->plan->zero_marks)
1066 switch (c->plan->shaper->zero_width_marks)
1067 {
1068 case HB_OT_SHAPE_ZERO_WIDTH_MARKS_BY_GDEF_LATE:
1069 zero_mark_widths_by_gdef (buffer: c->buffer, adjust_offsets: adjust_offsets_when_zeroing);
1070 break;
1071
1072 default:
1073 case HB_OT_SHAPE_ZERO_WIDTH_MARKS_NONE:
1074 case HB_OT_SHAPE_ZERO_WIDTH_MARKS_BY_GDEF_EARLY:
1075 break;
1076 }
1077
1078 /* Finish off. Has to follow a certain order. */
1079 hb_ot_layout_position_finish_advances (font: c->font, buffer: c->buffer);
1080 hb_ot_zero_width_default_ignorables (buffer: c->buffer);
1081#ifndef HB_NO_AAT_SHAPE
1082 if (c->plan->apply_morx)
1083 hb_aat_layout_zero_width_deleted_glyphs (buffer: c->buffer);
1084#endif
1085 hb_ot_layout_position_finish_offsets (font: c->font, buffer: c->buffer);
1086
1087 /* The nil glyph_h_origin() func returns 0, so no need to apply it. */
1088 if (c->font->has_glyph_h_origin_func ())
1089 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
1090 c->font->subtract_glyph_h_origin (glyph: info[i].codepoint,
1091 x: &pos[i].x_offset,
1092 y: &pos[i].y_offset);
1093
1094 if (c->plan->fallback_mark_positioning)
1095 _hb_ot_shape_fallback_mark_position (plan: c->plan, font: c->font, buffer: c->buffer,
1096 adjust_offsets_when_zeroing);
1097}
1098
1099static inline void
1100hb_ot_position (const hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
1101{
1102 c->buffer->clear_positions ();
1103
1104 hb_ot_position_default (c);
1105
1106 hb_ot_position_plan (c);
1107
1108 if (HB_DIRECTION_IS_BACKWARD (c->buffer->props.direction))
1109 hb_buffer_reverse (buffer: c->buffer);
1110
1111 _hb_buffer_deallocate_gsubgpos_vars (buffer: c->buffer);
1112}
1113
1114static inline void
1115hb_propagate_flags (hb_buffer_t *buffer)
1116{
1117 /* Propagate cluster-level glyph flags to be the same on all cluster glyphs.
1118 * Simplifies using them. */
1119
1120 if (!(buffer->scratch_flags & HB_BUFFER_SCRATCH_FLAG_HAS_GLYPH_FLAGS))
1121 return;
1122
1123 /* If we are producing SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL, then do two things:
1124 *
1125 * - If the places that the Arabic shaper marked as SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL,
1126 * are UNSAFE_TO_BREAK, then clear the SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL,
1127 * - Any place that is SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL, is also now UNSAFE_TO_BREAK.
1128 *
1129 * We couldn't make this interaction earlier. It has to be done here.
1130 */
1131 bool flip_tatweel = buffer->flags & HB_BUFFER_FLAG_PRODUCE_SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL;
1132
1133 bool clear_concat = (buffer->flags & HB_BUFFER_FLAG_PRODUCE_UNSAFE_TO_CONCAT) == 0;
1134
1135 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
1136
1137 foreach_cluster (buffer, start, end)
1138 {
1139 unsigned int mask = 0;
1140 for (unsigned int i = start; i < end; i++)
1141 mask |= info[i].mask & HB_GLYPH_FLAG_DEFINED;
1142
1143 if (flip_tatweel)
1144 {
1145 if (mask & HB_GLYPH_FLAG_UNSAFE_TO_BREAK)
1146 mask &= ~HB_GLYPH_FLAG_SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL;
1147 if (mask & HB_GLYPH_FLAG_SAFE_TO_INSERT_TATWEEL)
1148 mask |= HB_GLYPH_FLAG_UNSAFE_TO_BREAK | HB_GLYPH_FLAG_UNSAFE_TO_CONCAT;
1149 }
1150
1151 if (clear_concat)
1152 mask &= ~HB_GLYPH_FLAG_UNSAFE_TO_CONCAT;
1153
1154 for (unsigned int i = start; i < end; i++)
1155 info[i].mask = mask;
1156 }
1157}
1158
1159/* Pull it all together! */
1160
1161static void
1162hb_ot_shape_internal (hb_ot_shape_context_t *c)
1163{
1164 /* Save the original direction, we use it later. */
1165 c->target_direction = c->buffer->props.direction;
1166
1167 _hb_buffer_allocate_unicode_vars (buffer: c->buffer);
1168
1169 hb_ot_shape_initialize_masks (c);
1170 hb_set_unicode_props (buffer: c->buffer);
1171 hb_insert_dotted_circle (buffer: c->buffer, font: c->font);
1172
1173 hb_form_clusters (buffer: c->buffer);
1174
1175 hb_ensure_native_direction (buffer: c->buffer);
1176
1177 if (c->plan->shaper->preprocess_text &&
1178 c->buffer->message(font: c->font, fmt: "start preprocess-text"))
1179 {
1180 c->plan->shaper->preprocess_text (c->plan, c->buffer, c->font);
1181 (void) c->buffer->message(font: c->font, fmt: "end preprocess-text");
1182 }
1183
1184 hb_ot_substitute_pre (c);
1185 hb_ot_position (c);
1186 hb_ot_substitute_post (c);
1187
1188 hb_propagate_flags (buffer: c->buffer);
1189
1190 _hb_buffer_deallocate_unicode_vars (buffer: c->buffer);
1191
1192 c->buffer->props.direction = c->target_direction;
1193
1194 c->buffer->leave ();
1195}
1196
1197
1198hb_bool_t
1199_hb_ot_shape (hb_shape_plan_t *shape_plan,
1200 hb_font_t *font,
1201 hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1202 const hb_feature_t *features,
1203 unsigned int num_features)
1204{
1205 hb_ot_shape_context_t c = {.plan: &shape_plan->ot, .font: font, .face: font->face, .buffer: buffer, .user_features: features, .num_user_features: num_features};
1206 hb_ot_shape_internal (c: &c);
1207
1208 return true;
1209}

1212/**
1213 * hb_ot_shape_plan_collect_lookups:
1214 * @shape_plan: #hb_shape_plan_t to query
1215 * @table_tag: GSUB or GPOS
1216 * @lookup_indexes: (out): The #hb_set_t set of lookups returned
1217 *
1218 * Computes the complete set of GSUB or GPOS lookups that are applicable
1219 * under a given @shape_plan.
1220 *
1221 * Since: 0.9.7
1222 **/
1223void
1224hb_ot_shape_plan_collect_lookups (hb_shape_plan_t *shape_plan,
1225 hb_tag_t table_tag,
1226 hb_set_t *lookup_indexes /* OUT */)
1227{
1228 shape_plan->ot.collect_lookups (table_tag, lookups: lookup_indexes);
1229}
1230
1231
1232/* TODO Move this to hb-ot-shape-normalize, make it do decompose, and make it public. */
1233static void
1234add_char (hb_font_t *font,
1235 hb_unicode_funcs_t *unicode,
1236 hb_bool_t mirror,
1237 hb_codepoint_t u,
1238 hb_set_t *glyphs)
1239{
1240 hb_codepoint_t glyph;
1241 if (font->get_nominal_glyph (unicode: u, glyph: &glyph))
1242 glyphs->add (g: glyph);
1243 if (mirror)
1244 {
1245 hb_codepoint_t m = unicode->mirroring (unicode: u);
1246 if (m != u && font->get_nominal_glyph (unicode: m, glyph: &glyph))
1247 glyphs->add (g: glyph);
1248 }
1249}
1250
1251
1252/**
1253 * hb_ot_shape_glyphs_closure:
1254 * @font: #hb_font_t to work upon
1255 * @buffer: The input buffer to compute from
1256 * @features: (array length=num_features): The features enabled on the buffer
1257 * @num_features: The number of features enabled on the buffer
1258 * @glyphs: (out): The #hb_set_t set of glyphs comprising the transitive closure of the query
1259 *
1260 * Computes the transitive closure of glyphs needed for a specified
1261 * input buffer under the given font and feature list. The closure is
1262 * computed as a set, not as a list.
1263 *
1264 * Since: 0.9.2
1265 **/
1266void
1267hb_ot_shape_glyphs_closure (hb_font_t *font,
1268 hb_buffer_t *buffer,
1269 const hb_feature_t *features,
1270 unsigned int num_features,
1271 hb_set_t *glyphs)
1272{
1273 const char *shapers[] = {"ot", nullptr};
1274 hb_shape_plan_t *shape_plan = hb_shape_plan_create_cached (face: font->face, props: &buffer->props,
1275 user_features: features, num_user_features: num_features, shaper_list: shapers);
1276
1277 bool mirror = hb_script_get_horizontal_direction (script: buffer->props.script) == HB_DIRECTION_RTL;
1278
1279 unsigned int count = buffer->len;
1280 hb_glyph_info_t *info = buffer->info;
1281 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < count; i++)
1282 add_char (font, unicode: buffer->unicode, mirror, u: info[i].codepoint, glyphs);
1283
1284 hb_set_t *lookups = hb_set_create ();
1285 hb_ot_shape_plan_collect_lookups (shape_plan, HB_OT_TAG_GSUB, lookup_indexes: lookups);
1286 hb_ot_layout_lookups_substitute_closure (face: font->face, lookups, glyphs);
1287
1288 hb_set_destroy (set: lookups);
1289
1290 hb_shape_plan_destroy (shape_plan);
1291}
